introduction:
**Grid Alignment** gives you precise control over how items are positioned within their grid cells and how the entire grid is positioned within its container. CSS Grid provides alignment properties for both axes, letting you center, stretch, or distribute items exactly where you want them.

Understanding grid alignment is essential for creating polished layouts. While grid-template-columns and grid-template-rows define the structure, alignment properties control how content sits within that structure. This separation of concerns makes CSS Grid incredibly flexible.

This lesson covers justify-items, align-items, and place-items for cell alignment, as well as justify-content, align-content, and place-content for grid track alignment. You'll learn to center items perfectly, distribute space evenly, and handle common alignment scenarios.
content_markdown:
:::definition[title="Grid Alignment"]
CSS properties that control the positioning of grid items within their cells (items) and the positioning of the grid tracks within the container (content).
:::

## Two Types of Alignment

:::comparison[title="Items vs Content Alignment" left="Items (Cell Alignment)" right="Content (Track Alignment)"]
LEFT:
```css
/* Position items WITHIN their cells */
.grid {
  justify-items: center; /* horizontal */
  align-items: center;   /* vertical */
}

/* Affects where each item sits
   inside its grid cell */
```

RIGHT:
```css
/* Position tracks WITHIN container */
.grid {
  justify-content: center; /* horizontal */
  align-content: center;   /* vertical */
}

/* Affects where the entire grid
   sits within the container */
```

VERDICT:
Use `*-items` when you want to align items within their cells. Use `*-content` when your grid is smaller than its container and you want to position the entire grid.
:::

:::keypoints
- `justify-*` controls inline (horizontal) axis
- `align-*` controls block (vertical) axis
- `place-*` is shorthand for both axes
- Items: alignment within cells
- Content: alignment of tracks within container
:::

key_takeaways: justify-items and align-items position items within their grid cells
justify-content and align-content position the grid within its container
place-items and place-content are shorthand for both axes
justify-self and align-self override alignment for individual items
stretch is the default value for items alignment
content alignment only applies when the grid is smaller than its container
